definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: But Hawks and others say the news media misinterpreted the findings.
sentences.chinese: 但霍克和其他人说，新闻媒体曲解了调查结果。

sentences.english: Newspapers do not offer this indepth.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体不会对这类事情做深度报道。

sentences.english: The trend that the off-trade capital enters the business of newspaper has attracted more and more attention of news media.
sentences.chinese: 业外资本进入报业的潮流日益引起新闻媒体界的关注。

sentences.english: The government says it will not be bullied by the press.
sentences.chinese: 政府声称不会屈服于新闻媒体的压力。

sentences.english: First, policy makers are under constant scrutiny by the extensive media industry.
sentences.chinese: 第一，决策人始终处在广泛的新闻媒体的监督下。

sentences.english: The blaze was contained mostly to the fourth floor of the five-story building, the news agency said.
sentences.chinese: 大火烧了五层楼的四层楼，新闻媒体说。

sentences.english: Since then, the pair have avoided the media.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，两口子一直回避着新闻媒体。

sentences.english: Analyzes the inferior milk power incident, which is exposed by news media recently.
sentences.chinese: 对最近新闻媒体曝光的劣质奶粉事件进行了剖析。

sentences.english: This generation of baby boomers largely controls the news media and cultural life.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿潮中出生的一代已经控制了新闻媒体和文化生活。

sentences.english: The news media even gets involved.
sentences.chinese: 甚至新闻媒体也不甘寂寞。

sentences.english: The photos attracted enough attention that news organizations both in the U.K. and China soon took an interest.
sentences.chinese: 照片引起了中英两国新闻媒体的关注。

sentences.english: That sparked consternation, and a storm of criticism, in the news media and online.
sentences.chinese: 这一举动引起了恐慌以及新闻媒体和网络上的狂批。

sentences.english: The Chinese state-run news media have stepped up their hawkish tone since the episode.
sentences.chinese: 中国官方新闻媒体加强了自事件以来保持的鹰派论调。

sentences.english: The president defended the news blackout, accusing the media of misinforming the people.
sentences.chinese: 总统为新闻封锁进行了辩解，指责新闻媒体误导民众。

sentences.english: The images were widely printed and broadcast by South Korean news media.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片被大量的韩国新闻媒体出版和播放。

sentences.english: Freedom of Press becomes a special right of the news medias when they satisfy citizen's right-to-known.
sentences.chinese: 新闻自由是新闻媒体满足公民知情权的一项特殊权利。

definition: all walks of life/all social circles
to disseminate/to give publicity to/propaganda/CL:個|个[ge4]
official media/state media/(abbr. for 官方媒體|官方媒体)
